title: 110_s3140
content: The Act titled "Federal Employees Paid Parental Leave Act of 2008" provides for paid parental leave under Title 5. The Federal Employees Paid Parental Leave Act of 2008 allows employees to substitute paid leave for any unpaid leave under certain conditions. Paid leave options include 4 weeks of paid parental leave and accrued annual or sick leave. Paid parental leave under the Federal Employees Paid Parental Leave Act of 2008 allows employees to use paid leave without needing to exhaust other types of leave first. The paid parental leave is payable from agency funds, not considered annual or vacation leave, and does not carry over if unused after 12 months. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management oversees this provision. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management can increase paid parental leave to a maximum of 8 administrative workweeks, considering benefits to the government, costs, private sector trends, and the government's role as a model employer. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management can increase paid parental leave to a maximum of 8 administrative workweeks, considering factors such as the Federal Government's role as a model employer and other necessary regulations. The amendment will not be effective for any birth or placement before 6 months from the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. PAID PARENTAL LEAVE FOR CONGRESSIONAL EMPLOYEES. Amendment to Congressional Accountability Act includes a special rule for paid parental leave for congressional employees, allowing them to substitute paid leave for unpaid leave under the Family and Medical Leave Act. The Congressional Accountability Act amendment allows congressional employees to use paid leave for parental leave, equivalent to federal employees' paid parental leave, in addition to any extra vacation or sick leave provided by their office. No requirement to use other leave first. The Congressional Accountability Act amendment allows congressional employees to use paid parental leave from available funds, without the need to use other leave first. The leave must be used within a 12-month period and does not accumulate for future use. The Congressional Accountability Act amendment allows congressional employees to use paid parental leave within a 12-month period without needing to use other leave first. The leave is effective for births or placements occurring before the end of a 6-month period from the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENT TO FAMILY AND MEDICAL LEAVE ACT FOR GAO AND LIBRARY OF CONGRESS EMPLOYEES. Amendment to Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 allows GAO and Library of Congress employees to substitute paid leave for FMLA leave. The amendment allows employees to use paid parental leave corresponding to federal employees' leave entitlements, in addition to any extra vacation or sick leave provided by the employer. No requirement to exhaust other leave types before using paid parental leave. The amendment allows employees to use paid parental leave from available funds, not accumulating for future use if unused within 12 months. The amendment allows employees to use paid parental leave within 12 months, effective for births or placements before the end of a 6-month period from the enactment of this Act.
